page.title: 05BUILDING MATERIALS
page.content: The most commonly used material is natural stone which comes from a Quarry near by at Much Wenlock{.There {are a lot of old timber framed houses. Some houses are built with red bricks and mortar. Most of the roofs are covered in clay tiles . Old windows are often leaded light windows . Guttering is mostly metal. Quite a few houses are rendered.{Modern buildings have plastic guttering, and concrete or clay tiles. They are very often rendered bricks. Less wood is used in their construction and more concrete. Sometimes extensions or whole{new {buildings}are built with stone in the traditional way . Farm buildings, out houses and village halls are built with cheaper materials like corrugated steel or asbestos, timber, roofing felt and breeze blocks.
